name: Intellectual Disability
description: Deficits in intellectual and adaptive functioning with onset during the developmental period.

name: Global Developmental Delay
description: Significant delay in multiple developmental domains in early childhood.

name: Unspecified Intellectual Disability
description: Intellectual disability with insufficient assessment information.

name: Language Disorder
description: Persistent difficulties in the acquisition and use of language.

name: Speech Sound Disorder
description: Difficulty producing speech sounds correctly.

name: Childhood-Onset Fluency Disorder
description: Disturbance in speech fluency and timing patterns, commonly known as stuttering.

name: Social Pragmatic Communication Disorder
description: Impairment in the social use of verbal and nonverbal communication.

name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
description: Persistent deficits in social communication and restricted, repetitive patterns of behavior.

name: Attention-Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
description: Persistent pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity.

name: Specific Learning Disorder
description: Difficulties learning and using academic skills.

name: Developmental Coordination Disorder
description: Impairment in the acquisition and execution of coordinated motor skills.

name: Stereotypic Movement Disorder
description: Repetitive, nonfunctional motor behavior that interferes with normal activities.

name: Tourette’s Disorder
description: Multiple motor and at least one vocal tic present for more than one year.

name: Persistent Motor or Vocal Tic Disorder
description: Motor or vocal tics lasting more than one year.

name: Provisional Tic Disorder
description: Motor and/or vocal tics present for less than one year.

name: Other Specified Tic Disorder
description: Clinically significant tic disorder not meeting full diagnostic criteria.

name: Unspecified Tic Disorder
description: Tic disorder with insufficient information to specify the type.

name: Delusional Disorder
description: Presence of one or more delusions lasting at least one month without other prominent psychotic symptoms.

name: Brief Psychotic Disorder
description: Sudden onset of psychotic symptoms lasting at least one day but less than one month.

name: Schizophreniform Disorder
description: Schizophrenia-like symptoms lasting at least one month but less than six months.

name: Schizophrenia
description: Chronic psychotic disorder characterized by delusions, hallucinations, disorganized thought, and functional impairment.

name: Schizoaffective Disorder
description: Psychotic symptoms occurring concurrently with mood disorder episodes.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Psychotic Disorder
description: Psychotic symptoms caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Psychotic Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Delusions or hallucinations resulting from a medical condition.

name: Catatonia
description: Marked psychomotor disturbance associated with mental or medical conditions.

name: Other Specified Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder
description: Clinically significant psychotic symptoms not meeting full diagnostic criteria.

name: Unspecified Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder
description: Psychotic disorder with insufficient information for specific diagnosis.

name: Bipolar I Disorder
description: Characterized by one or more manic episodes, often with depressive episodes.

name: Bipolar II Disorder
description: Characterized by hypomanic episodes and one or more major depressive episodes.

name: Cyclothymic Disorder
description: Chronic mood instability with hypomanic and depressive symptoms not meeting full criteria.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Bipolar Disorder
description: Bipolar symptoms caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Bipolar Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Bipolar symptoms resulting from an underlying medical condition.

name: Other Specified Bipolar Disorder
description: Clinically significant bipolar symptoms that do not meet full diagnostic criteria.

name: Unspecified Bipolar Disorder
description: Bipolar symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder
description: Severe irritability and frequent temper outbursts in children, with persistent negative mood.

name: Major Depressive Disorder
description: Persistent depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure causing significant impairment.

name: Persistent Depressive Disorder
description: Chronic depressive symptoms lasting for at least two years (dysthymia).

name: Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder
description: Severe mood symptoms linked to the menstrual cycle.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Depressive Disorder
description: Depressive symptoms caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Depressive Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Depressive symptoms resulting from an underlying medical condition.

name: Other Specified Depressive Disorder
description: Clinically significant depressive symptoms not meeting full diagnostic criteria.

name: Unspecified Depressive Disorder
description: Depressive symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Separation Anxiety Disorder
description: Excessive fear or anxiety about separation from attachment figures.

name: Selective Mutism
description: Consistent failure to speak in specific social situations despite speaking in others.

name: Specific Phobia
description: Marked fear or anxiety about a specific object or situation.

name: Social Anxiety Disorder
description: Significant fear or anxiety about social or performance situations.

name: Panic Disorder
description: Recurrent unexpected panic attacks with persistent concern or behavior change related to the attacks.

name: Agoraphobia
description: Marked fear or anxiety about situations where escape may be difficult or help unavailable.

name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
description: Excessive anxiety and worry occurring more days than not for at least six months.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Anxiety Disorder
description: Anxiety symptoms caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Anxiety Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Anxiety symptoms resulting from a medical condition.

name: Other Specified Anxiety Disorder
description: Clinically significant anxiety symptoms not meeting full criteria for another anxiety disorder.

name: Unspecified Anxiety Disorder
description: Anxiety symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
description: Presence of obsessions and/or compulsions that are time-consuming or cause significant distress or impairment.

name: Body Dysmorphic Disorder
description: Preoccupation with perceived defects or flaws in physical appearance not observable to others.

name: Hoarding Disorder
description: Persistent difficulty discarding possessions, regardless of value, leading to clutter and distress.

name: Trichotillomania (Hair-Pulling Disorder)
description: Recurrent pulling out of one's own hair, resulting in hair loss and distress or functional impairment.

name: Excoriation (Skin-Picking) Disorder
description: Recurrent picking of skin, leading to lesions, distress, or impairment.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced OCD
description: Obsessive-compulsive symptoms caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: OCD Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Obsessive-compulsive symptoms caused by a medical condition.

name: Other Specified OCD-Related Disorder
description: Clinically significant obsessive-compulsive symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified OCD-Related Disorder
description: Obsessive-compulsive symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Reactive Attachment Disorder
description: Inhibited, emotionally withdrawn behavior toward caregivers in children, due to insufficient care.

name: Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder
description: Overly familiar and culturally inappropriate behavior with strangers in children, associated with insufficient care.

name: Posttraumatic Stress Disorder
description: Exposure to a traumatic event resulting in intrusive memories, avoidance, negative mood, and hyperarousal.

name: Acute Stress Disorder
description: Short-term (3 days to 4 weeks) post-trauma reaction with intrusion, dissociation, and hyperarousal symptoms.

name: Adjustment Disorders
description: Emotional or behavioral symptoms in response to an identifiable stressor, occurring within three months of the stressor.

name: Other Specified Trauma-Related Disorder
description: Clinically significant trauma-related symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Trauma-Related Disorder
description: Trauma-related symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Dissociative Identity Disorder
description: Disruption of identity characterized by two or more distinct personality states with recurrent gaps in memory.

name: Dissociative Amnesia
description: Inability to recall important autobiographical information, usually of a traumatic or stressful nature.

name: Depersonalization/Derealization Disorder
description: Persistent or recurrent experiences of detachment from oneself or surroundings, causing distress or impairment.

name: Other Specified Dissociative Disorder
description: Clinically significant dissociative symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Dissociative Disorder
description: Dissociative symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Somatic Symptom Disorder
description: One or more somatic symptoms that are distressing or result in significant disruption of daily life, with excessive thoughts, feelings, or behaviors related to the symptoms.

name: Illness Anxiety Disorder
description: Preoccupation with having or acquiring a serious illness, with minimal or no somatic symptoms.

name: Conversion Disorder (Functional Neurological Symptom Disorder)
description: Neurological symptoms incompatible with medical or neurological conditions, causing distress or impairment.

name: Factitious Disorder Imposed on Self
description: Falsification of physical or psychological signs or symptoms, or induction of injury or disease, in oneself, without obvious external reward.

name: Factitious Disorder Imposed on Another
description: Falsification of physical or psychological signs or symptoms, or induction of injury or disease, in another person, without obvious external reward.

name: Other Specified Somatic Symptom Disorder
description: Clinically significant somatic symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Somatic Symptom Disorder
description: Somatic symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Pica
description: Persistent eating of nonnutritive, nonfood substances over a period of at least one month.

name: Rumination Disorder
description: Repeated regurgitation of food, which may be re-chewed, re-swallowed, or spit out.

name: Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID)
description: Eating or feeding disturbance leading to inadequate nutritional or energy intake, not due to body image concerns.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
description: Restriction of energy intake leading to significantly low body weight, intense fear of gaining weight, or disturbance in body image.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
description: Recurrent episodes of binge eating followed by compensatory behaviors to prevent weight gain.

name: Binge-Eating Disorder
description: Recurrent episodes of binge eating without compensatory behaviors.

name: Other Specified Feeding or Eating Disorder
description: Clinically significant feeding or eating symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Feeding or Eating Disorder
description: Feeding or eating symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Enuresis
description: Repeated voiding of urine into bed or clothes, whether involuntary or intentional, at an age where continence is expected.

name: Encopresis
description: Repeated passage of feces into inappropriate places, whether involuntary or intentional, at an age where continence is expected.

name: Insomnia Disorder
description: Persistent difficulty initiating or maintaining sleep, or non-restorative sleep, causing distress or impairment.

name: Hypersomnolence Disorder
description: Excessive sleepiness despite a main sleep period lasting at least seven hours, causing distress or impairment.

name: Narcolepsy
description: Recurrent periods of irrepressible need to sleep, lapsing into sleep, or napping, often with cataplexy or hypocretin deficiency.

name: Breathing-Related Sleep Disorders
description: Sleep disruption due to breathing-related problems such as obstructive sleep apnea.

name: Circadian Rhythm Sleep-Wake Disorders
description: Persistent misalignment between the individual's sleep pattern and the desired or socially acceptable sleep schedule.

name: Nightmare Disorder
description: Repeated occurrences of extended, extremely dysphoric, well-remembered dreams, usually involving threats to survival or security.

name: Sleep Terror Disorder
description: Recurrent episodes of abrupt terror arousals from sleep, usually during the first third of the night, with intense fear and autonomic arousal.

name: Sleepwalking Disorder
description: Repeated episodes of rising from bed during sleep and walking about, usually with amnesia for the episode.

name: REM Sleep Behavior Disorder
description: Repeated episodes of arousal during REM sleep associated with vocalization and/or complex motor behaviors.

name: Restless Legs Syndrome
description: Urge to move the legs, usually accompanied by uncomfortable sensations, worse at rest and relieved by movement.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Sleep Disorder
description: Sleep disturbance caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Delayed Ejaculation
description: Marked delay in or inability to achieve ejaculation during sexual activity.

name: Erectile Disorder
description: Persistent difficulty in obtaining or maintaining an erection sufficient for sexual activity.

name: Female Orgasmic Disorder
description: Persistent delay, infrequency, or absence of orgasm in women during sexual activity.

name: Female Sexual Interest/Arousal Disorder
description: Lack of, or significantly reduced, sexual interest or arousal in women.

name: Genito-Pelvic Pain/Penetration Disorder
description: Persistent or recurrent difficulties with vaginal penetration, pain, fear, or tension during intercourse.

name: Male Hypoactive Sexual Desire Disorder
description: Deficient or absent sexual thoughts or desire in men causing distress or interpersonal difficulty.

name: Premature (Early) Ejaculation
description: Ejaculation occurring within a short time following penetration, with minimal sexual stimulation.

name: Substance or Medication-Induced Sexual Dysfunction
description: Sexual dysfunction caused by substance use, intoxication, withdrawal, or medication effects.

name: Other Specified Sexual Dysfunction
description: Clinically significant sexual dysfunction not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Sexual Dysfunction
description: Sexual dysfunction with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Gender Dysphoria in Children
description: Marked incongruence between experienced/expressed gender and assigned gender in children, causing significant distress or impairment.

name: Gender Dysphoria in Adolescents and Adults
description: Marked incongruence between experienced/expressed gender and assigned gender in adolescents and adults, causing significant distress or impairment.

name: Oppositional Defiant Disorder
description: A pattern of angry/irritable mood, argumentative/defiant behavior, or vindictiveness lasting at least six months.

name: Intermittent Explosive Disorder
description: Recurrent behavioral outbursts representing a failure to control aggressive impulses, causing harm or destruction.

name: Conduct Disorder
description: Repetitive and persistent pattern of behavior violating societal norms or the rights of others.

name: Antisocial Personality Disorder
description: Pervasive pattern of disregard for and violation of the rights of others, beginning in childhood or early adolescence and continuing into adulthood.

name: Pyromania
description: Deliberate and purposeful fire setting on more than one occasion, with tension or affective arousal before the act and pleasure or relief afterward.

name: Kleptomania
description: Recurrent failure to resist impulses to steal objects not needed for personal use or monetary value.

name: Other Specified Disruptive Disorder
description: Clinically significant disruptive, impulse-control, or conduct symptoms not meeting full criteria for another disorder.

name: Unspecified Disruptive Disorder
description: Disruptive, impulse-control, or conduct symptoms with insufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Alcohol Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of alcohol use leading to clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Caffeine Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of caffeine use causing significant impairment or distress.

name: Cannabis Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of cannabis use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Hallucinogen Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of hallucinogen use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Inhalant Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of inhalant use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Opioid Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of opioid use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Sedatives/Hypnotics/Anxiolytics Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of sedative, hypnotic, or anxiolytic use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Stimulant Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of stimulant use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Tobacco Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of tobacco use causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Other/Unknown Substance Use Disorder
description: Problematic pattern of use of other or unknown substances causing clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Gambling Disorder
description: Persistent and recurrent problematic gambling behavior leading to clinically significant impairment or distress.

name: Substance Intoxication
description: Development of a reversible substance-specific syndrome due to recent ingestion of a substance.

name: Substance Withdrawal
description: Development of a substance-specific problematic behavioral change with physiological and cognitive symptoms due to cessation or reduction of substance use.

name: Substance-Induced Mental Disorders
description: Mental disorders that are caused by the effects of substances, including intoxication or withdrawal.

name: Delirium
description: A disturbance in attention and awareness, developing over a short period, with fluctuating severity, typically due to an underlying medical condition or substance.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder
description: Significant cognitive decline from a previous level of performance in one or more cognitive domains, interfering with independence in daily activities.

name: Mild Neurocognitive Disorder
description: Modest cognitive decline from a previous level of performance in one or more cognitive domains, not interfering with independence in daily activities.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Alzheimer's Disease
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to Alzheimer’s pathology.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Vascular Disease
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to vascular disease or cerebrovascular pathology.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Lewy Body Disease
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to Lewy body pathology.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Traumatic Brain Injury
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to traumatic brain injury.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Parkinson’s Disease
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to Parkinson’s disease.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to HIV
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to HIV infection.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Huntington’s Disease
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to Huntington’s disease.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder, Substance/Medication-Induced
description: Major cognitive decline caused by substance use or medication effects.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Major cognitive decline attributable to another medical condition not specified above.

name: Major Neurocognitive Disorder Due to Multiple Etiologies
description: Major cognitive decline resulting from multiple contributing conditions.

name: Unspecified Major Neurocognitive Disorder
description: Major cognitive decline with insufficient information to specify etiology.

name: Paranoid Personality Disorder
description: Pervasive distrust and suspiciousness of others such that their motives are interpreted as malevolent.

name: Schizoid Personality Disorder
description: Detachment from social relationships and a restricted range of emotional expression.

name: Schizotypal Personality Disorder
description: Acute discomfort in close relationships, cognitive or perceptual distortions, and eccentric behavior.

name: Antisocial Personality Disorder
description: Pervasive pattern of disregard for and violation of the rights of others, beginning in childhood or early adolescence.

name: Borderline Personality Disorder
description: Instability in interpersonal relationships, self-image, and affects, with marked impulsivity.

name: Histrionic Personality Disorder
description: Excessive emotionality and attention-seeking behavior.

name: Narcissistic Personality Disorder
description: Pervasive pattern of grandiosity, need for admiration, and lack of empathy.

name: Avoidant Personality Disorder
description: Social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy, and hypersensitivity to negative evaluation.

name: Dependent Personality Disorder
description: Excessive need to be taken care of, leading to submissive and clinging behavior and fears of separation.

name: Obsessive-Compulsive Personality Disorder
description: Preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, and control at the expense of flexibility, openness, and efficiency.

name: Personality Change Due to Another Medical Condition
description: Persistent personality disturbance that is a direct physiological consequence of another medical condition.

name: Other Specified Personality Disorder
description: Personality disturbance causing significant impairment but not meeting full criteria for any specific disorder.

name: Unspecified Personality Disorder
description: Personality disturbance causing significant impairment without sufficient information for a specific diagnosis.

name: Voyeuristic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from observing an unsuspecting person who is naked, undressing, or engaging in sexual activity.

name: Exhibitionistic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from exposing one’s genitals to an unsuspecting person.

name: Frotteuristic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from touching or rubbing against a non-consenting person.

name: Sexual Masochism Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from being humiliated, beaten, bound, or otherwise made to suffer.

name: Sexual Sadism Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from the physical or psychological suffering of another person.

name: Pedophilic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal involving sexual activity with a prepubescent child or children.

name: Fetishistic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from the use of non-living objects or specific focus on non-genital body parts.

name: Transvestic Disorder
description: Recurrent and intense sexual arousal from cross-dressing that causes distress or impairment.

name: Neuroleptic-Induced Parkinsonism
description: Parkinsonian symptoms such as tremor, rigidity, and bradykinesia caused by antipsychotic medication use.

name: Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome
description: A life-threatening reaction to antipsychotic drugs, characterized by fever, muscle rigidity, autonomic instability, and altered mental status.

name: Medication-Induced Acute Dystonia
description: Sudden, sustained muscle contractions or abnormal postures caused by medications, typically antipsychotics.

name: Medication-Induced Akathisia
description: A movement disorder characterized by a subjective feeling of inner restlessness and an urge to move, often caused by medications.

name: Medication-Induced Tardive Dyskinesia
description: Repetitive, involuntary, purposeless movements, usually of the face or extremities, caused by long-term use of antipsychotic medication.

name: Other Medication-Induced Movement Disorder
description: Movement disorders caused by medications that do not meet criteria for the above specific syndromes.
